Serban,

To actually answer your question, a lot of artists work by the piece rather
than by the hour. You give them the design, they give you a quote, and then
you work out a deal. Depending on where and how the art is used, there may be
royalties involved. Some artists will work for much less if they can retain
the right to re-sell the art to others.

Check out http://www.turbosquid.com/ and browse a bit. You might find what you
want there. If not, you can certainly find a willing artist in the forums or
by contacting them directly about the work you find on Turbo Squid. The forums
and the art will give you a good idea on what you can expect to pay for
various levels of quality. The art at Turbo Squid is all royalty free with a
one time, reasonable cost. Most of the artists found there will make custom
work along the same lines (reasonably cheap, by the job, and royalty free).

~Jon McClure

Serban Porumbescu <sdporumbescu@...> wrote:

Hi All,

I need some help figuring out the various costs associated with hiring 
artists on a contract basis.  I know that no project is the same and 
that it's hard to just throw out some number, but on average about what 
should I expect to pay per hour?

To be a little more specific,  I need 2D artwork.  Some of the games by 
PopCap (www.popcap.com) like Bookworm and Insaniquarium! are 
representative of the type of artwork I'm interested in.

Thanks in advance for all your help.

	Serban :-)
